    The difference between the locus and right comparisand.

    The spatial coordinate of the knot.

    An array of coordinates in the mesh.
    Vec3 Ray3.dir
    The ray's direction.
    Vec3 Curve3.Knot3.foreHandle
    The handle which warps the curve segment heading away from the knot along the direction of the curve.
    Vec3 Quaternion.imag
    The coefficients of the imaginary components i, j and k.
    Vec3 Vec3.ComparatorDist.locus
    The locus against which points are compared.
    Vec3 Mesh3.Vert3.normal
    The direction in which light will bounce from the surface of the mesh at the vertex.
    Vec3[] Mesh3.normals
    An array of normals to indicate how light will bounce off the mesh's surface.
    Vec3 Ray3.origin
    The ray's origin point.
    Vec3 Curve3.Knot3.rearHandle
    The handle which warps the curve segment heading towards the knot along the direction of the curve.

    static Vec3 Vec3.cross​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target)
    The cross product returns a vector perpendicular to both a and b, and therefore normal to the plane on which a and b rest.

    a × b :=
    ( ay bz - az by ,
    az bx - ax bz ,
    ax by - ay bx )

    The cross product is anti-commutative, meaning a × b = - ( b × a ) .
    static Vec3 Vec3.crossNorm​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target)
    A specialized form of the cross product which normalizes the result.
    static Vec3 Vec3.crossNorm​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target, Vec3 crossed)
    A specialized form of the cross product which normalizes the result.

    static Vec3 Vec3.clamp​(Vec3 a, Vec3 lowerBound, Vec3 upperBound, Vec3 target)
    Clamps a vector to a range within the lower- and upper-bound.
    static Vec3 Vec3.clamp01​(Vec3 a, Vec3 target)
    Clamps the vector to a range in [0, 1].
    abstract int Vec3.AbstrComparator.compare​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    The compare function which must be implemented by sub- (child) classes of this class.
    int Vec3.ComparatorDist.compare​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    Compares two vectors by subtracting the locus from each, then comparing the dot products of the respective differences.
    int Vec3.ComparatorZYX.compare​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    Compares the z, y and x component.
    int Vec3.compareTo​(Vec3 v)
    Returns -1 when this vector is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'.
    static Vec3 Vec3.copySign​(Vec3 magnitude, Vec3 sign, Vec3 target)
    Finds first vector argument with the sign of the second vector argument.
    static Vec3 Vec3.cross​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target)
    The cross product returns a vector perpendicular to both a and b, and therefore normal to the plane on which a and b rest.

    a × b :=
    ( ay bz - az by ,
    az bx - ax bz ,
    ax by - ay bx )

    The cross product is anti-commutative, meaning a × b = - ( b × a ) .
    static Vec3 Vec3.crossNorm​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target)
    A specialized form of the cross product which normalizes the result.
    static Vec3 Vec3.crossNorm​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target, Vec3 crossed)
    A specialized form of the cross product which normalizes the result.
    static void Mat4.decompose​(Mat4 m, Vec3 trans, Quaternion rot, Vec3 scale)
    Decomposes a matrix into its constituent transforms: translation, rotation and scale.
    static Vec3 Vec3.diff​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target)
    Finds the absolute value of the difference between two vectors.
    static float Vec3.dist​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    Finds the Euclidean distance between two vectors.
    static float Vec3.distChebyshev​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    Finds the Chebyshev distance between two vectors.
    static float Vec3.distEuclidean​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    Finds the Euclidean distance between two vectors.
    static float Vec3.distManhattan​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    Finds the Manhattan distance between two vectors.
    static float Vec3.distMinkowski​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, float c)
    Finds the Minkowski distance between two vectors.
    static float Vec3.distSq​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    Finds the Euclidean distance squared between two vectors.

    Divides a scalar by a vector.

    Divides a vector by a scalar.

    Divides the left operand by the right, component-wise.
    static float Vec3.dot​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b)
    Finds the dot product of two vectors by summing the products of their corresponding components.

    a · b := ax bx + ay by + az bz

    The dot product of a vector with itself is equal to its magnitude squared.
    static Vec3 Vec3.down​(Vec3 target)
    Returns to a vector with a negative value on the z axis, (0.0, 0.0, -1.0) .
